text:
It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experience as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may be applicable. It is important for you to know, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces.

If you have any particular experiences or difficulties in answering the questions, give particulars of these separately at the end of the questionnaire.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada for years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Days What Did You Discover?" and would be willing to do so please put a check mark here ( ).

Western Canadian Pioneers' Day is still being organized. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so please put a check mark here ( ).

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark this one you would be willing to answer.

In 1908 Michael (John) and his family moved from the Westfield Town to the town of Newburyport.

Many years later, Michael (John) died in 1938.

He was a member of the First Church of Christ, Scientist.

He was also a member of the School Board from 1920-1931 and the Board of Education from 1932 to 1948.

He was also a member of the Orange Lodge No. 13.

Mrs. Florence M. Walcott lived in the town of Newburyport.

Her husband, Michael (John), died in 1938.

She was also a member of the Orange Lodge No. 13.

She died in 1948.

The town of Newburyport was named after the town of Newburyport, Massachusetts.
